Directions
Put the lemongrass, coriander, mint, allspice, and gentian root in a sealable glass jar. Muddle briefly to bruise and break the ingredients. Add the celery seeds, celery, and vodka, then seal and shake. Let this mixture steep for 12 days, shaking daily.
Strain out solids using a fine-mesh strainer, reserving the liquid in the original jar. Place the solids in a saucepan along with the water and cook on medium heat for 5 to 7 minutes. It will come to a gentle boil and the liquid will reduce slightly. Let this cool, then return all the pan's contents to the original jar. Let steep for 2 more days.
Strain out the solids, then filter the liquid through a coffee filter or cheese cloth. If using cheese cloth, you may have to do this 2 or 3 times until the liquid is free from debris. Store at room temperature for up to a year.
Special Equipment
Fine-mesh strainer
, saucepan, cheesecloth or coffee filter
